description: From Spanish bonanza (“calm sea, fair weather, good luck, rich lode”), from Medieval Latin bonacia (“fair weather”), a blend of bonus (“good”) +‎ malacia (“calm sea”).

entries.meaning: (mining) A rich mine or vein of silver or gold.
The point at which two mother lodes intersect.
(by extension, figurative) Anything which is a great source of wealth or yields a large income or return.
examples: The popular show quickly became a ratings bonanza for the network.
